website_summaries.verdict: Originally designed to leave Geisha makeup undisturbed, these blotting papers are made with abaca leaf, which prevents over-drying.
pros: Made from all-natural abaca leaf, which doesn't over-dry skin
23k gold flecks to remove excess oil
cons: Seems to take more wipes to pick up oil than other brands
Some say it's because they pick up oil left behind by other brands

website_summaries.verdict: Made with with all-natural abaca leaf, these blotting papers pick up more oil than other wipes without overdrying your skin.
pros: Made from all-natural abaca leaf, which doesn't over-dry skin
Contains 23-karat gold flecks to remove excess oil
cons: Seems to take more wipes to pick up oil than other brands
Some say it's because they pick up oil left behind by other brands

customer_reviews.title: Pros and Cons...
customer_reviews.text: Downsides: Pricey. But it's Tatcha, so what else would one expect? Haha, no, the little golden flecks in the sheets don't do anything but make them look more arty. Upsides: These seem to be good at leaving makeup unperturbed while reducing shine. It's really easy to tell when a sheet is saturated and therefore probably of less use (the paper looks like vellum and goes slightly transparent). No scent or coating at all and doesn't annoy my stupidly sensitive skin. Verdict: I will keep using, but I'm not well versed with alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: shademar

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the better face blotting products out there. it is sturdier than most and doesn’t tear while using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great! They are more expensive than most but well ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They are more expensive than most but well above the average blotter. In effort to find more inexpensive blotters I've bought others and were greatly disappoionted and have come back to these.
customer_reviews.author: Sara :)

customer_reviews.title: They work! Not an every day kind of product but handy for "photo moments"
customer_reviews.text: The Work! They really do get the oil and shiny under control, sometimes for a few hours even. The Problem? If you have really oily skin as I do it takes as many as 5 of these little sheets to get your face to look good for 1 Night. And trust me, the package doesn't have that many for it to be all that worthwhile to keep using on a daily use. But for special nights and those picture moments, they do work!
customer_reviews.author: JesseP.

customer_reviews.title: Love the charcoal ones
customer_reviews.text: I love these charcoal strips. They are effective at removing oil. The key is to press the strip for three seconds flip and onto the next spot. One sheet is enough for my t-zone. These are the best non irritating I've found. My daughters also use these.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: These blotting papers work soooo well. Nice large size. Easy to carry I my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love these blot papers!! They are larger than most and are great at absorbing oil. They also don’t remove or move your makeup. A little pricey but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Best blotting sheets!
customer_reviews.text: These may be expensive but you get what you pay for. Takes away oil while leaving your makeup intact unlike most other blotting sheets. Will repurchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tissues
customer_reviews.text: While this product appears to be expensive, I think it's a case of you get what you pay for. It's great for absorbing excess facial oil. I have rosacea and none of the recommended skin creams have given the results that I've gotten from using these tissues a couple of times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Melcher

customer_reviews.title: This is the best blotting paper I've ever found
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blotting paper I've ever found. I only wish they sold packets larger than 30 count.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: It works great but way too expensive and you don't get very many.
customer_reviews.author: aubrey king

customer_reviews.title: Amazing magic stuff
customer_reviews.text: If by 2pm your forehead is greasy enough to fry 4 eggs on it, get these. Amazing magic stuff. Do it.
customer_reviews.author: Keira

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Best I've used. Does require to use 2-3 for whole face, but pulls up the most oil and leaves everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: YES
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect oil plotting paper. The heft is great, and it absorbs like crazy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Piazza

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about these!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best! A little luxury I'll never be without.
customer_reviews.author: MWTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Worried About the Price? Don't. Oily girl MUST.
customer_reviews.text: Does not take off makeup, does not smell weird, does not have small sheets. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: mrspeanutsr

customer_reviews.title: These sheets work really well leaving your face pretty matte after
customer_reviews.text: These sheets work really well leaving your face pretty matte after. The quantity however was not sufficient for how quickly i use the sheets
customer_reviews.author: CBella

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They really absorb a lot of oil without making you look dry or too matte. They also don't mess with makeup and are a good, big size.
customer_reviews.author: mestrand

customer_reviews.title: Quality service!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon has most of the products I'm looking for. The Aburatorigami japanese beauty papers are for skin care (face.)
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Too bad they're so expensive
customer_reviews.text: Really soaks up the oils on my face. Too bad they're so expensive. I try to only use them when I really need it.
customer_reviews.author: honolulufamily

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best blotting paper. I have oily skin and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: worth
customer_reviews.text: these are crazy absorbent I use like 4 at a time lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best.
customer_reviews.text: Best oil absorbing sheets out there. I'm very oily and only need one sheet. Even though the gold flake stuff is dumb, I do think these are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Person

customer_reviews.title: Tatcha Original Aburatorigami
customer_reviews.text: No need for touch up powder, these work like magic. The thin paper does not move your makeup around and gets rid of shine now! Except no other, these are the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for summers east of the Mississippi
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for a train on a sticky, muggy subway platform is one of the more disgusting experiences in an NYC summer. I have plastered these to my forehead and neck, and they mop up all that grossness, leaving me with soft, non-sweaty skin. Indispensable, and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: WaHi

customer_reviews.title: Best blotters!
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to oil up my face more just so I can bust these babies out more often. Not only are they the most effective oil blotting sheets I've used, they are very delicate and pretty as well. They are slightly pricier than other sheets I've bought, but in my opinion the price difference it worth it. They make my shiny forehead look matte. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: They work. But not as well as Clean & Clear or Shiseido. Which both cost less per sheet. Save your money unless you really want the pretty package.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Love!!! But I think a square of tissue paper will do the exact same thing
customer_reviews.author: shara

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price to me. The generic version ...
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price to me. The generic version of the clean and clear ones from Kroger pick up more oil, pull up less makeup, and are a fourth of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Overrated. Feels like ordinary, gift tissue paper cut into squares. It picks up the oil and that's nice, but I still had to use powder to get a nice matte look. Wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rick R.

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These work really well. I just wish they were cheaper. I use them sparingly for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get over how wonderful these sheets are. Yes, they are a bit costly, but they absorb oil so efficiently that I'm willing to pay the price.
customer_reviews.author: lilacrose

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite. I wish they were less expensive
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oil blotting paper
customer_reviews.text: The best oil blotting papers ever created ....can use both sides....absolutely hands down the best.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy LP

customer_reviews.title: Best oil sheets on the market
customer_reviews.text: Pricey, but high quality. A must for those with oily skin. Love!
customer_reviews.author: summerl

customer_reviews.title: Worth trying, you might love it!
customer_reviews.text: These work amazingly well. I wasn't even aware I had that much oil on my face until I saw how saturated the paper was. I always use these now after applying foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Kaci

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure why I love these over cheaper blotting papers out there
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why I love these over cheaper blotting papers out there, but the size is bigger and they really do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: At this price, I had a higher expectation than cheaper brands but sadly it is comparable to cheaper brands.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: best there is
customer_reviews.text: Great blotting papers - the best I've found. Really do the job well - remove oil and don't touch your foundation.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: If you have very oily skin, you need to use at least three sheets at a time. So for me, I used at least six to eight sheets a day and my fingertips became oily with each use. The linen sheets from Mary Kay or the paper sheets with powder work best for extremely oily skin. The gold flakes are a useless novelty that added no value whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: TLALONDE16

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever! The paper is a decent size and goes a long way. Pricey but worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Peggy

customer_reviews.title: The expensive 'adulting' version of what you're used to buying
customer_reviews.text: I don't really feel there's a huge difference between this product and, say, what you buy in a drugstore. However, I do feel more elegant and refined when I'm not patting my face down with what looks like a blue plastic tarp, so there's that. This feels more 'grown up' and I appreciate that about this product.
customer_reviews.author: propernice

customer_reviews.title: Best paper
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Dries up oil really well and keeps makeup in tactb
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Wombles

customer_reviews.title: These sheets are like none other
customer_reviews.text: These sheets are like none other. They are in a class all by themselves. Love these but I can not use them everyday because of the high cost. I wish I could buy these in bulk at a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: SEC

customer_reviews.title: Tatcha's best product
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for every woman. It leaves your skin feeling fresh and glowing. The packaging is beautiful and as are gold flaked papers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not that absorbent
customer_reviews.text: When I discovered that my usual store brand blotting sheets have mineral oil, I wanted to switch to something different. This packaging was so pretty, but it's just not as effective as I would have hoped. The sheets are hard to manage, and require firmer pressing, even over obvious shine spots. So I wouldn't recommend these for oil/combo skin--they lifted off more makeup than oils-- they might work better for light touch ups in a drier climate or for someone with balanced skin. Will keep looking for a replacement to the drugstore brand...
customer_reviews.author: Bibliotek

product_meta.title: Tatcha Original Aburatorigami Japanese Blotting Papers - 30 Sheets
